        Methylprednisolone suleptanate (Promedrol) is indeed a prodrug of methylprednisolone being developed by Pharmacia Corp (formerly Pharmacia & Upjohn) for the treatment of asthma. A prodrug is an inactive form of a drug that is metabolically converted into its active form in the body after administration (Stella, 1985). In this case, Methylprednisolone suleptanate (Promedrol) is metabolized into Methylprednisolone after being administered.

        
        Methylprednisolone is a type of corticosteroid that is commonly used in treating asthma due to its anti-inflammatory properties (National Asthma Education Prevention Program, 2007). Corticosteroids reduce inflammation in airways by suppressing immune cells that release chemicals causing inflammation (Barnes, 2013).
